intro: Streptocarpus kungwensis, commonly known as the Kungwensis streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in shades of purple and blue. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental foliage and blooms.
